choices.D: The same administrator can lock more than one ADOM at the same time.
choices.C: Unlocking an ADOM will install configuration changes automatically on managed devices.
choices.B: Ungraceful closed sessions will keep the ADOM in a locked state until the administrator session times out.
choices.A: Unlocking an ADOM will submit configuration changes automatically to the approval administrator.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BD
B and D are correct
Correct B and D

C,D
Study guide

C & D correct

C & D are the correct answers
A & B are not correct, cuz ADOM revisions are not linked to FMG configuration, and does not contain ADOM settings

Answer is C & D

Selected Answer: CD
"It is possible to keep a revision history of changes made at the policy and objects level. However, unlike at the device
level, the revision history at this level can significantly increase the overall size of your configuration backup." - FortiManager 7.2.0 Best Practices p18

choices.A: ADOM revisions can create System Checkpoints for the FortiManager configuration.
choices.C: ADOM revisions can significantly increase the size of the configuration backups.
choices.B: ADOM revisions can save the current state of the whole ADOM.
choices.D: ADOM revisions can save the current state of all policy packages and objects for an ADOM.

choices.A: You must restart the secondary unit if you promote it to become the primary.
choices.D: No FortiGuard packages have been synchronized between the cluster members yet.
choices.C: FortiAnalyzer features are not enabled on this FortiManager device.
choices.B: A failover will take place after five minutes without receiving heartbeat packets.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Correct Answer: C
Study guide page 293

A is incorrect : Study guide page 293 "Don't need to reboot devices when promoting from secondary to primary"
B is incorrect : Study guide page 293 "When the monitored interface for the primary is down, HA failover will occur automatically"
D is incorrect : Study guide page 292 "FortiGuard Antivirus/IPSpackages, webfilter, antispam databases are not synchronized"

Selected Answer: C
Correct Answer: C.
FortiManager 7.4 Administrator Study Guide - Page No:11.

FortiManager 7.4 Administrator Study Guide page 11
lf FortiAnalyzer features are enabled, you cannot add FortiAnalyzer to FortiManager. You will also not be able to configure FortiManager high availability (HA)

10s*30=300s=five minutes. And the fortiguard packages are never synchronized between the cluster members :
